etymology.description: 武(武) (wǔ, "military; martial"), 昌(昌) (chāng, "prosperous; flourishing")
etymology.interpretation: 武昌 (wǔchāng) is the name of a district in Wuhan, China, known for its historical significance as a site of revolutionary activity. The name suggests a place where martial or military strength and prosperity come together, perhaps reflecting the area's strategic and economic importance historically.

examples.chinese: 武昌展现繁荣(武昌展現繁榮)。
我参观武昌(我參觀武昌)，感受那里的军魂(感受那裡的軍魂)。
examples.pinyin: wǒ cānguān wǔchāng, gǎnshòu nàlǐ de jūnhún
examples.english: I visited Wuchang and felt the military spirit there.
